column4: I had my smb server working great for 27 days, and then I rebooted and now it won't show up in the windows network.  Any ideas?
Might seem like a dumb question, but are you sure the services are set to start on boot?
any other ideas? I'll take anything atm
Did you check to see if the services are running?  If so, I missed your reply.  Can you connect to the machine by IP or by name?  I assume you mean that you can not browse to it.
The services are running, I can do $ smbclient -L localhost and it shows information but I can't use nautilus, or my xbox, or a windows machine to browse it
Can you connect to the share directly from your Windows machine?  Just type \\machinename\sharename in the address bar of your explorer window?
Or use the IP address...
let me give that a shot real quick
Okay
no dice
You haven't inadvertently activated a firewall, have you?
Mmm, not that I know of.  How would I check?
Hmm...  In Ubuntu?  Not sure.  Try "sudo iptables -L".
I have a whole mess of stuff in there.  The last time I did that I remember it being empty
perhaps I should look into this :X
Sounds like you have a firewall.
If you don't, you should see three chains (INPUT, OUTPUT, FORWARD) with empty rule lists.
would the firewall also prevent me from seeing my share in nautilus?
Quite possibly.
ahh, I'm an idiot.  You were so right.  I had installed firestarter a long time ago but turned it off.  Hasn't rebooted in 27 days and it kicked back in on restart
thank you so much for the help
I've done worse.  :)
Any time.
